To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

30.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
30.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Immediately, instantly, at once. From ek and the genitive case singular feminine of autos; from that hour, i.e. Instantly.

30.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
30.str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An accuser, prosecutor. From kata and agora; against one in the assembly, i.e. A complainant at law; specially, Satan.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

30.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

30.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
30.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

31.str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.

31.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
31.str2: To give orders to, prescribe, arrange. From dia and tasso; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. institute, prescribe, etc.

31.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
31.str2: To take up, raise; I pick up, take on board; I carry off, lead away. From ana and lambano; to take up.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From the same as Antipas; Antipatris, a place in Palestine.

32.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Tomorrow. From epi and aurion; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. to-morrow.

32.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
32.str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of para and emballo; a throwing in beside, i.e., battle-array, encampment or barracks.

32.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
32.str2: To allow, permit, let alone, leave. Of uncertain affinity; to let be, i.e. Permit or leave alone.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A horse-soldier, a mounted soldier, a cavalryman. From hippos; an equestrian, i.e. Member of a cavalry corps.

32.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
32.str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

32.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

33.str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

From Kaisar; Caesaria, the name of two places in Palestine.

33.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
33.str2: To send up, deliver, hand over, yield. From ana and didomi; to hand over.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hegeomai; a leader, i.e. Chief person of a province.

33.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
33.str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

33.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
34.str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
34.str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

34.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular
34.str2: Of what sort. From the base of pou and hoios; individualizing interrogative what sort of, or which one.
Sphere of duty, province. From a compound of epi and archo; a special region of government, i.e. A Roman pr?Fecture.

34.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
34.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
34.str2: To ask, inquire, ascertain by inquiry, understand.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Probably of foreign origin; Cilicia, a region of Asia Minor.

35.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.

35.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
35.str2: To hear throughout, of a judicial hearing. Middle voice from dia and akouo; to hear throughout, i.e. Patiently listen.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

35.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
35.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
An accuser, prosecutor. From kata and agora; against one in the assembly, i.e. A complainant at law; specially, Satan.

35.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
35.str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.

35.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
35.str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.

35.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.
Of Latin origin; the praetorium or governor's courtroom.
